revised_title: Reversible Gelation in Living Protoplasm: A Study of Colloidal Systems
tldr: This article explores the properties of colloidal systems, specifically the reversible gelation in living protoplasm. The author, W.M. Bayliss, examines the behavior of particles in protoplasm under dark-ground illumination and discusses the implications of this phenomenon in cell biology. The study also investigates the effects of electrical stimulation on protoplasm, revealing the reversible gelation as a regular condition of cell activities.
